page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: The area surveyed in this block is mainly rural. On the eastern boundary of the block lies the small village of Chattenden and on the north west boundary lies the larger village of Cliffe Woods. Approximately half the area belongs to the Ministry of Defence. Most of this land is taken up by Chattenden Barracks, its training areas and the married quarters at Lodge Hill.Some of the land is leased to a local farmer but because of its rough nature and dual role it is mainly only suitable for sheep farming Most of the land in the rest of the block is used for fruit farming as typified by Mockbeggar Farm or arable farming eg. at Chattenden and a little market gardening eg. at Wainscott. Chattenden village lies on a chalk escarpment on the westerly edge of the Hoo Peninsula.It was originally a
